original: HJALMARSON, Jarl Harald, Direktör, Stockholm, f Hbg 15/6 04 av öv.ljt H H o Blenda Lindberg, gm Eywor Dahlén. Studex Upps 23, jur kand 29. Statsmin sekr 29—30, sekr o omb.m i Hög riksorg 30—37, sekr Handelns arb.giv.org (Köpmännens garantifrn) 37—41, 2. dir där sed. 41, vkst dir Förs.-bol forhandl.org sed. 42. Led arb.rådet f be-handl av butikstängn.lagen sed. 42, Sthlms folksk.direkt sed. 42, styr.led Sthlms hdls-mellansk sed. 43, Sthlmshögern sed. 38, arb.-utsk sed. 42. Av trycket: Brosch o art i press i pol a arb.rättsl frågor.
translated: HJALMARSON, Jarl Harald, Director, Stockholm, b. Helsingborg 15/6 1904, son of Lieutenant Colonel H. Hjalmarson and Blenda Lindberg, married to Eywor Dahlén. Studied at Uppsala University until 1923, graduated with a law degree in 1929. Secretary to the Prime Minister from 1929 to 1930, secretary and representative in the Supreme Court from 1930 to 1937, secretary of the Employers' Association (Merchants' Guarantee) from 1937 to 1941, deputy director since 1941, acting director of the Trading Corporation since 1942. Member of the Workers' Council for the Retail Trade Act from 1942, Director of Stockholm's elementary school system from 1942, board member of Stockholm's inter-trade association from 1943, member of the Stockholm Right Party from 1938, member of the Labor Committee from 1942. Published brochures and articles in the press on labor law issues.
